intro: Sinolegumenea chendezhaoana, commonly known as the Zhaoan legume, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of China and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It produces leguminous pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional herbal medicine. The botanical features of Sinolegumenea chendezhaoana make it an important species for both ecological and medicinal studies.
